Welcome Adventurer!

Select Character
Start
North
West
South
East
Save
You travel north and come upon a lush, green meadow. You hear a faint rustle coming from the north. What would you like to do?
A group of three goblins jump out of the bush. You take out your weapon to fight!
You have successfully defeated the 3 goblins.
In the distance an outline of a town comes into view. The road heads north, east, and west. There is a sign that reads: North: Town, East: Cave, West: Forest

You come across a traveler resting on the road. The traveller tells you that there has been an abundance of goblin attacks lately and the guild will reward you for each proof of kill. You thank him and wish him well on his journey.
Continuing towards the town, you start looking for any signs of goblin hordes. There is a small cluster of houses to your north, probably the village the traveller hailed from.

You arrive at the village and ask around for info on goblin sightings. The villagers are excited at the news but unfortunately, as they stay in or near the village there was very little news. They do tell you of a horde of goblin that settled in an abandoned mine shaft towards the west. You thank them for the info.
You are given 5 health and 5 mana potions.
Here sits a lone farm, dilapidated by the years. There is nothing here.
You search the farm and to your surprise you find a health potion and 20 gold, along with broken and unusable adventurer equipment.
You head west as toward the mining shaft to try and kill the goblin horde.
You continue towards the mine shaft. You hear a faint sound, stopping and hiding in nearby tall grass, you focus and hear goblin screeches down the road.
You come across a small patrol consisting of 5 goblins. You take out your weapon to fight!
After your fight with the goblin patrol, you are now sure there is a goblin horde near.
You prepared yourself and headed west toward the mine shaft. You see the entrance of the mine shaft but no goblins.
Heading inside the mine shaft, you come see a small goblin settlement consisting of 10 goblins. Continuing would mean fighting the horde all at once, continue at your own risk.
The goblin horde detects your presence and releases a battle screech.
You head north and the town starts to get clearer.
Nothing to view here, the town gets closer and closer. You should be able to reach it soon.

You arrive at the town and ask a nearby resident for the layout of the town. The resident tell you the guild is towards the north and that the potion shop and the equipment shop is at either end of the fork before getting to the guild.
You head down the road towards the guild, there are houses to both side of you.
You head into the house to your right. A woman screams at the sudden intrusion and you are thrown into jail.
You head into the house to your left. There is no one in the house.
You find 10 gold and boots.
You continue north. The guild comes closer.
You come across the fork. To the north is the guild entrance. To the west is item shop. To the east is the equipment shop.
Welcome to the item shop! What would you like to buy?
Welcome to the equipment shop! What would you like to buy?
Welcome to the guild! How can we help you?

Outside the town there are two pathways to go. To the northwest off in the distance there resides the castle of the current demon overlord. To the northeast lies a forest where it is rumored that trolls reside.
On the path to the demon overlord\'s castle, you come across two bridges and two statues. A sign reads "Only those who are worthy can cross the bridge. Cannot cross back."
The statues come to life and starts speaking "Welcome traveller, to reach the other side you must choose right to get across. Which will you choose?
Past the bridge, the land ahead is noticeably darker and less lively.
The few life grow scarcer and scarcer as you head towards the castle.
You come across the remains of a skirmish. You see dead adventurers and orcs and goblins alike.
You searched through the items of the dead and come out with 3 health potions, 2 mana potions, and better equipment.
You reach a cave with a sign that reads :Labrynth.
Where would you like to go?
